Authors: Yu Pei Tan, Roger G. Shivas, Pedro W. Crous
Title:
Cryptic species of Curvularia in the culture collection of
the Queensland Plant Pathology Herbarium
Keywords:
Dothideomycetes, multigene phylogeny, taxonomy, 13 new
sp
Abstract:
Several unidentified specimens of Curvularia deposited in
the Queensland Plant Pathology Herbarium were re-examined. Phylogenetic
analyses based on sequence data of the internal transcribed spacer
region, partial fragments of the glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate
dehydrogenase and the translation elongation factor 1-Î± genes, supported
the introduction of 13 novel Curvularia species. Eight of the species
described, namely, C. beasleyi sp. nov., C. beerburrumensis sp. nov., C.
eragrosticola sp. nov., C. kenpeggii sp. nov., C. mebaldsii sp. nov., C.
petersonii sp. nov., C. platzii sp. nov. and C. warraberensis sp. nov.,
were isolated from grasses (Poaceae) exotic to Australia. Only two
species, C. lamingtonensis sp. nov. and C. sporobolicola sp. nov., were
described from native Australian grasses. Two species were described
from hosts in other families, namely, C. coatesiae sp. nov. from Litchi
chinensis (Sapindaceae) and C. colbranii sp. nov. from Crinum zeylanicum
(Amaryllidaceae). Curvularia reesii sp. nov. was described from an
isolate obtained from an air sample. Furthermore, DNA sequences from
ex-type cultures supported the generic placement of C. neoindica and the
transfer of Drechslera boeremae to Curvularia.
